column1: beautiful timing. He spots the shorter length early, shifts back and away from the line of the ball to open up a gap to the right of point
hangs back again and pats a flatter delivery outside off to cover

past slip! Beautiful work from Mehidy, tossing the ball up, getting it to drift away at the very last possible moment, leaving the batsman stranded as he lunges forward to block the original line of the ball.
hacks a shortish delivery to deep midwicket; the pull shot is more a short-arm jab because he doesn't have too much room
lovely bowling - he angles it onto off stump from around the wicket. The length is full. It draws the new batsman forward, and Karunaratne is rather reluctant to do so. Defends well enough though
firm push into the covers as he steps towards the flight of the ball on off stump
there's that constricting line, from around the wicket, angled into the right-hander, off a shortish length. Mendis tries to cut but can't get proper timing
defends a good length ball on off stump
slides back in his crease and presents the full face with aplomb
hammers it to the midwicket boundary. Picks the length up quickly and shovels the ball over the infield; it's not a full-blooded pull. More a lift, with a desire to unsettle the comeback man
ignores a good length ball turning away outside off
fetches a leading edge as Mendis closes the face of the bat to a ball on leg stump a touch too early
defends in line with middle stump as the new ball skids through with the angle
a smidge of spin on offer, and it's all the more potent considering Mehidy's line, angling into off stump.
beats him as the new ball bites into the pitch and bounces past the outside edge. He's in superb rhythm against the left-hander
Karunaratne invests in a longer stride to handle the turn, and he does it very well
pushes a full delivery outside off through the covers to get off the mark. Good stuff.
hangs deep in his crease to defend a good length ball on off stump
shimmies down the pitch to tap the ball down the ground
kicks away the front foot to make sure he has the leeway to flick a ball cramping him on middle and leg sweetly through midwicket
tosses it up, nice and slow, onto middle stump. Kusal blocks
nice stride forward. head over the ball, straight bat in play
flatter trajectory which allows Mendis to go back and nudge it to short leg
draws him forward with his flight, but Mendis is capable enough to blunt its threat
87kph, goes back to block a quicker delivery on middle

pushes a flighted delivery on off stump towards mid-off and pinches a quick single - good stuff from Karunarante, he spots Taijul Islam hanging on his heels, and in his rush to get to the ball, he slips on the outfield and may well have hurt his side. He chooses to stay on the field though.
lovely work with the wrists, letting the shortish ball come to him so that he can play close to his body and deflect it to the right of short leg
goes back to a good length ball and defends
draws him forward but Mendis has it well covered
a flick off middle stump but Bangladesh have set a good field for Mehidy to attack the stumps

does him in and Razzak is on the board after four years in the wilderness. Big smile from the veteran as he angles the ball into the left-hander, and it keeps drifting, making him panic, especially seeing as he's down the pitch. A hasty flick comes out, but by that time the ball has danced past the inside edge, spins through his legs and Liton Das behind the stumps does the rest
good length ball - a fairly quick one - and Dhananjaya calmly gets forward to meet it
drift again, and Dhananjaya manages only an inside edge as gets forward to block
good length ball outside off, steers it to point
blocks it like he's in Lego Land
good length ball outside off, lets it come onto his bat and glides it to point
misfield at long leg, which is in some ways fair considering Mehidy bowls short and down the leg side. Pulls it away
spectacularly hit over midwicket. It's short. It sits up and it's unceremoniously smashed

catch it the cry, and it only just evades Kayes as he runs and dives to his left. Mehidy was so close to the perfect ball - pitching it on a good length and yet confusing the batsman, who does not know whether he has to go forward or back. Eventually Mendis plays from the crease, gets a thick inside edge and survives
puff of dust as Dhananjaya plays back, tries to flick and is struck on the pads
straightens and there's a mini-explosion from the pitch again. Poor Dhananjaya. He comes searching for the ball, and is left clueless as it zips past the outside edge
a hint of room on offer and Mendis displays a superb cover drive
outside edge but Mendis controls it well, playing late and close to his body
a few to many short balls, in between a few jaffas, and Sri Lanka have whacked all of them away. A basic pull shot would do here and Mendis knows that
defends a good length ball in line with the stumps
pushes it through outside off and Mendis ignores it
gets forward and smothers any turn on this full delivery on off stump
opens the face, as he makes room on leg stump, and pushes the flatter delivery through cover
positions himself in front of all three stumps - he's almost standing on top of them - and blocks

short-arm pull as he heaves the ball away to deep square leg. The length is only just short. The line doesn't do him any favours, cramping him from freeing the arms. So he uses his wrists to get the power he is denied
rocks back and carves the flatter, quicker delivery outside off through point.
he's across on off stump this time and with the ball drifting into him he has to be quite careful about bringing the bat down straight lest he gets struck in front
whip-pulls it between square leg and midwicket on the boundary. Sensational connection on a ball that seemed to quicken up off the pitch. Amazing strokeplay from Mendis this morning

that's outstanding work! He spent the last over hiding in his crease. Here he races forward like a happy puppy at the sight of its owner and launches a perfectly good length ball into the striaight boundary
punches it through cover
defends a full delivery on leg stump
drop it short and you get nothing from this pitch. No mercy from the batsman either as Mendis rocks back and pummels it to the left of midwicket.
good length ball outside off, defends with an open face
full on middle, but Mendis is happy keeping back to it
it's short even from the new bowler and Dhananjaya hits it sweetly to deep point
goes back, waits for it to turn, and then swats it to the left of midwicket
eases it down the ground to long-off; Sri Lanka's footwork, even from their newest batsman, has been brilliant
a little dip allows the ball to turn off the straight, Mendis minds that possibility with an open face
steers it through point, off the front foot
slider coming in with the arm and Dhananjaya is able to handle the threat using quick hands and a straight bat
covers the angle of the back of a length ball and blocks it on top of the bounce
shoulders arms to a good length ball outside off. Good judgment because that pitched in line with the stumps but carries on with the angle from over the wicket
invites the drive, Mendis accepts, and ends up a little red-faced because he's thoroughly beaten. Good speeds from Mustafizur
pitches it up on middle and off, Mendis lets it go after covering his sticks
shuffles across and leaves the ball outside off
goes full on off stump, Mendis pushes it to mid-off

beautiful cricket! He turns another good delivery into a gimme ball, charging down the pitch, giving the bowler no indication of those nefarious intentions. And then it's all about the shot - a graceful lift over cover.
steps out again, but this time Taijul does his bit to cramp the batsman and makes sure he hits it to mid-off
quicker and flatter and Dhananjaya slices it to point
ventures out of his crease again and is met with a rapid delivery on middle. Defends it well
fiiiiieeerrrrce! How can a spinner toss the ball up when he's being treated like this? Dhananjaya skips out of his crease and majestically launches it over the straight boundary.
good length ball on and around off stump, defends
runs a back of a length delivery towards point
the sucker ball - he's ever so good at it too, danging it full and wide but not too wide - Mendis isn't quite seduced by its wiles
beats him as a good length ball hits the deck on leg stump and cuts away. First sign of the Mustafizur fast offbreak
good length on off stump, Mendis defends with soft hands, looking a little tentative, but he is alert to the possibility of a quick single into the covers
a firm straight drive finds Mustafizur in its firing line
full and outside off, doesn't care for it
defends a flatter delivery on middle and leg
squares him up a bit with his turn. But Mendis has such good hands, and he's adamant about playing as late as possible
blocks a good length delivery on leg stump; seems to have got a bit more bounce
brings down a straight bat on off stump
nudges a flatter delivery on leg stump to short leg
presents the full face outside off
traps him in the crease but there isn't enough movement on offer for that to be fatal. Dhananjaya defends with soft hands and the outside edge goes to point
firmly behind a good length ball on off stump
pushes at it from the crease, and again despite that he isn't in too much trouble. Keeps the ball down as it goes to cover
good length, outside off, no hsot
short ball, but it comes off ever so slowly off the pitch. So much that Dhananjaya has to delay his pull shot and then roll his wrists to make sure it goes straight down and then to square leg
cutter and it squares up the right-hander. Nevertheless, Mendis knocks it down by his feet and goes to take a well earned drink
back of a length on off, shifts back and punches towards mid-off
extra turn and bounce, rips away from a length and gets big on him after drawing him forward. Manages to keep it out with control into the off side
ah, this is lovely bowling. More of this. A length ball, sliding so sharply into middle and drawing him forward. He pushes forward and the ball shaves the outside edge with turn and bounce
comes down the track to smother the spin and puts himself in an awkward position because he can't meet the pitch and it tucks him up. Hits the pad
fuller, slid across outside off, pushes off the front foot into the covers
length ball, spins away towards off, defended off the front foot
full and sliding in on off, pushed back
slider on middle, finds the inside of his bat as he defends
full and tight on middle and off, defended back
looped up on middle and leg, driven to mid-off
length ball, turns minimally as he stays inside the crease and defends
pitched further up this time on middle and leg, driven to long-on
sliding fuller ball on leg, blocked off the front foot
pitched up on middle and leg, defended
fullish, slight turn outside off, presses forward and pushes into the covers for one
shifts back and shuffles across but the ball comes on at a leg-stump line and hits his pad as he is caught in two minds
length, sliding on middle and leg, opens him up slightly with turn as he defends from the crease
fuller, crunches a drive towards mid-off
full and slid in on middle and leg, blocked down the pitch

gives him the charge and gets right to the pitch before pummeling this to the left of the bowler. The bat turns in his hands and as a result the ball stays along the ground. The bowler gets a bit of a hand to it as he gets down but the ball only deflects towards the mid-on region and carries to the boundary nevertheless
pushed into the off side
full on middle and off, blocked down the pitch
similar line and length, puts his head down and blocks
full, sliding on middle, defended
just short of good length, forcing him back with pace as he defends into the off side
draws him forward with a length ball that turns away to find the outside edge. He was pushing gently forward and hence the ball goes along the ground past the cordon
front-foot defense down the pitch
slider on leg, blocked off the front foot
looped up outside off, chases away from the body for a half-hearted push and the ball goes off the inside edge past the stumps. Misses it narrowly
full, spinning in towards off, pushes into the covers for a quick single
dangerous leave. Oh, dear! That almost shaved off-stump. He's expecting it to turn away but it just slides on with the arm
shifts back and forces a cut through the covers
length ball, spinning towards middle, stays back and tucks to midwicket
non-turning back of a length delivery around off, shuffles across and punches through the cover and point region
backs away and tries to force a cut and chops it into the surface off the inside edge as it comes on with the arm. Loose shot
good length, tight on off, blocked off the front foot
stays back and cuts a back of a length delivery with no room to the covers
full around off, driven off the front foot through the covers. Looking for a quick single because of a slight misfield but decide against it
floated up around off, defended off the front foot
sliding fuller one on middle and leg, stays back and blocks down the pitch
looped up outside off, presses forward and pushes through the covers
short of a length, pitching outside off, stays back and flays it to short leg who cops a painful blow on the thigh
flattish trajectory, comes down the track to meet the pitch and pushes down to long-on
short of a length around off, rocks back and cuts extremely hard to extra cover who gets down to his right in a flash and makes a clean stop
looped up around off, blocked off the front foot
advances down the ground and drives out to long-off
length on off, defended back off the outside of the bat
short, spinning in on off, shifts back and fays a cut to sweeper cover
gets down for a big sweep. The ball's not full enough and he gets a bit of a top-edge as a result. Sails all the way over deep midwicket, and brings up the fifty for Mendis
shifts back and whips against the turn towards midwicket
sliding fuller one on middle, blocked down the pitch
backs away and forces a cut to one that keeps low around middle and off, chopped towards cover
full and sliding on leg, blocked off the front foot
short of a length outside off, backs away and punches through point
length, spinning on middle and leg, kept out from the crease
full outside off, turns it away to midwicket with a stride forward
back of a length around off, punched off the backfoot to long-on
just back of a length outside off, too much width, and Gunathilaka punches off the backfoot through point. This is what Bangladesh ought to avoid: boundary balls
crisply driven off the front foot to extra cover who intercepts it with a drive
short and wide, cut off the backfoot to cover
full on middle, front-foot defence to silly point
back of a length, very loopy, turns away slightly but just enough to beat the outside edge and miss off-stump
fuller outside off, driven into the covers
oh, shot. Susses out the line and length and plants the front foot across before controlling a sweep through midwicket. Rolls his wrists and plays it right along the ground
back of a length, stays back and sticks the bat out to drop it to point
another sweep, this time from around middle and off and behind square

that's a lousy shot, really. Why would you be playing that kind of a shot after getting your eye in on this kind of a track? Rocks on to the backfoot and dares to clear mid-off with a slap. Chips it straight over the fielder's head and he takes it comfortably with his hands reverse-cupped

oh, what a delivery! That's a top delivery. Straight through the defences of Chandimal. Loopy sliding length ball, lots of revs on the delivery, draws Chandimal forward and gets it to rip away past the outside edge to flatten his off stump. Razzak - what a comeback into Test cricket he's having! On a hat-trick now
ah, close. Short of a length, comes on with the arm on off, keeps a little low, keeps it out off the backfoot
fuller this time, comes on with the angle again towards middle and leg, defended into the on side off the front foot
short of a length, punched to cover
fuller, flicked to midwicket for one
stays back to a short of a length delivery, kept out off the backfoot
sliding on middle, defended off the inside of the bat towards short leg
gets the front foot forward and gets beaten as the ball turns past the outside edge. Kept the bat slightly inside
short of a length, turns away outside off, punched off the backfoot into the covers

has he taken it? Sabbir at first slip seems to suggest he has hit the surface. The umpires have referred this upstairs. Soft signal is not out. Ah, that has clearly bounced short. Short of a length, just straightens outside off but extra bounce results in an outside edge and first slip gets down to his left with his hand outstretched
full, sliding on middle and leg, driven away to cover
flighted on middle, defended down the pitch
short of a length, straightens on off, backs away and cuts to cover
sharp turn from well outside off, keeps his bat inside the line
turn and bounce, closer this time but still wide enough, keeps his bat inside again
full on middle and leg, drilled to mid-on
looped up outside off and that has been crunched through the covers for four
length on off, defended into the off side off the front foot
turns a mile away from outside off, keeps the bat inside the line
back of a length, straightens on middle, shifts back and tucks it behind square
again keeps his bat inside as this one turns away from the off-stump channel
loopy fuller ball on middle, blocked off the front foot down the pitch
short of a length, minimal turn outside off, no shot offered
too short and Mendis latches onto it without remorse, rocking back and pulling the ball away furiously

what a rippah! It's the length that traps Mendis. He has to come forward to it, but Razzak does not let him get anywhere near the pitch. That means the batsman has to predict how much it will turn. Mendis underestimates as he tries to defend. And the ball skips past the outside edge to crash into the off stump
keeps to his crease to defend a good length ball
excellent cricket, hurrying out of his crease to meet the flighted ball on the full and tapping it to mid-on
makes sure to press forth to the pitch of the ball and smother it on middle stump
shapes to advance but then remembers he shouldn't take too much risks with his team already five down. Blocks off the front foot

keeps low! There's puffs of dust. There's stumps taking a battering. There's Sri Lankan batsmen trudging back shaking their heads every other minute. The chaos starts with Dickwella premeditating a move down the pitch. Taijul pulls his length back and pushes it through quicker. Then the pitch lends him a helping hand as the ball sneaks under the bat
nudges a full delivery on middle through midwicket
he's been stoic with his defence all this time but the moment he sees a short ball, he rocks back and hammers it through cover point
sneaks a full delivery down leg. Silva looks for a leg glance, playing as close to his body as he could, and that's why he misses
tosses it up nicely, and so long as the ball is in the air, the batsman is in the wars. He knows he will have very little time to adjust to whatever happens off the pitch. Silva defends hurriedly
fullish on off stump, blocks
gets forward to defend a good length ball on off stump. It skirts off the outside edge to deep third man
blocks a full one on off stump
leans into a pretty-looking drive to cover. A misfield allows a single
pads up to a good length ball on and around off stump. A hint of turn means he is able to weather the lbw appeal
good length, outside off, no shot
hides his bat inside the line of the ball, so that when it turns it goes right past the outside edge
full and outside off, Silva lunges forward to the pitch of it and blocks
brings the bat down straight, hands holding it softly. All that spin is rendered useless
angles it closer to leg stump to try and square him up, but Silva is still up for it
targets middle stump with a full length, Silva won't allow it to go past him
gets out of his crease to whip the ball to mid-on. Ends up getting too close to the ball to have leverage
strides forward to block a good length ball outside off
goes to flick a good length ball with the angle, failing to account for the turn and is nearly punished for it. The leading edge pops up but, luckily for Dilruwan, it goes down
nudges a full one angled into his pads to short leg
loops it up on middle and off, Dilruwan smacks it back at the bowler
shapes to cut but the ball isn't quirt short enough. Gets a bottom edge
gives it some air on off stump, Dilruwan works it back to the bowler
steps forward and presents the straight bat, making sure to keep it close to his pad
good hands as he gets into position to defend the ball on off stump and then completely kills the turn
gets down the pitch, and too close to the ball, as he shovels it to mid-off
a shade short and Silva is at it, cutting hard to deep point
defends a loopy delivery on off stump
blocks a fullish delivery on off stump - and this one goes on with the arm to take the inside edge. It's tough batting out there
covers for the turn as Razzak spears the ball into leg stump, and flicks it to the right of short leg. Great wrist work
superb shot; he's a good man to have in the middle, a counter-attacker, as he shows here, lunging forward to the ball on leg stump and sweetly putting it away to deep midwicket.
nudges it off his pads again to square leg
works it off leg stump to deep midwicket
stays back to a fairly full delivery and so has to hurry into defending the ball on leg stump

the wicket-taker's taken to the cleaners again. Razzak is starting to throw up freebies, showing signs that he has indeed been out of Test cricket for four years until today. Short and wide, and it's smashed through point
looks to flick a good length ball on off stump through midwicket. Gets a leading edge
strides down the pitch but again he ends up yorking himself
sharp turn and Silva, by virtue of that technique where he plays inside the line of the ball, escapes an absolute jaffa
pushes it through on middle and leg, blocks
nudges to mid-on and pinches a quick single
good footwork, jumping back in his crease against a delivery that is only just short, and therefore finds himself in superb position to flick through midwicket
short of a good length on off stump. Allows Dilruwan to play off the back foot
short again - and quite slow through the air too - Dilruwan flicks it to midwicket
eases back in his crease for a sublime little late cut, swindling the short ball right out of the wicketkeeper's gloves
full on middle and off, defends

that's the arm ball - and Silva kills all the threat it poses with such a gentle touch. He's on middle stump, the front foot taking a cursory trip down the pitch. Then he watches - ever so closely - as the ball comes down on middle and then turns into him. His heightened concentration allows him to adjust and meet the ball almost casually
blocks a good length ball outside off
slides it into middle and off, Dilruwan keeps it out
on the pads and DIlruwan is able to turn it to the left of short leg
glorious shot, straight over the bowler's head, having used his feet to get close to the pitch of a good length ball
full and outside off, spears it through cover
rocks back to the flatter ball outside off and whips it through midwicket

the bat is safely tucked behind his front pad as he lets a good length ball go outside off. Then he seems to be asking for some help from the dressing room, pointing at his left shoulder. They physio is out there, checking on his range of movement. Impromptu check up done. He's good to continue
dangles a good length ball outside off, Dilruwan doesn't bite
back of a length and outside off, Dilruwan has an easier leave
full on off stump, defends very well
attempts to steer a yorker-length delivery outside off through point, but is beaten for pace. And that blip in concentration makes his partner walk down and have a chat

dropped by second slip! Poor cricket, from both Dilruwan for being tempted by a ball outside off, and by Sabbir, letting a simple catch, coming at waist-high, spill out. Mustafizur though is punished after doing everything right - even getting the ball to straighten on this bone-dry pitch
shuffles across onto off stump and leaves the ball outside his eyeline
plays late, brings his wrists into play and keeps the good length ball down before it goes to short leg
looms over the full delivery on middle, waits for it to reach him, and as soon as it does, he whips it straight of midwicket
shifts his weight back to deal with a short of a good length ball outside off. The open face allows him a single to the left of cover. This is an excellent partnership
it's overpitched outside off, and because of that he dares to hit against the turn, in search of a single to the right of mid-on
fairly short, and angled too far down leg. It has hit me all over it. Dilruwan though ends up inside edging it onto his pad as he goes for an almighty pull
leans into the cover drive, looking every bit like a top-order batsman
back of a length and outside off, no shot
defends a good length ball outside off to gully
blocks a fullish delivery on off stump
there's the bouncer a shade outside off - that's good thinking considering Dilruwan is shuffling across. Makes him take evasive action
fuller delivery outside off, defends
short one again, perfectly directed, climbing up to Dilruwan's chest. But the batsman does equally well, pulling his bottom hand off the bat and running the ball gently to gully
short on off stump, and then keeps low. But the lack of pace off the pitch, and Silva's determination to play as late as possible helps him spirit it away behind square leg
slides into the pads and Dilruwan sends it away deftly to the long leg boundary. Minimum effort, maximum reward

he's spraying it all over the place, having problems with line and length now. This is wildly overpitched, and very wide outside off as well. Diruwan spears it behind point. One hit away from securing a vital fifty-run partnership
quicker through the air on off stump, but Dilruwan is well prepped for it, shifting back and across to cut to point
full and outside off, defends
good length on off stump, keeps it out
shortish and outside off, Dilruwan blocks
full on off stump, defends towards point and sneaks a quick single
pushes at a full delivery - it's a surprise for him considering he is caught in the crease - and the ball goes in the air for a distance as he knocks over the stumps at the other end
there's the bouncer, well outside off, and Roshen drops his wrists
good length and outside off, lets it go
clips a shortish delivery, bringing his hands up to get on top of the bounce, and then working his wrists to find a single at midwicket.
pitched up on off, blocked off the front foot
advances and meets the pitch before carving out a drive to wide long-off. Fifty of the partnership up
length ball, spins away to take the outside part of the bat as he presses forward and defends to silly point
good length around off, plants the front foot forward and defends solidly off the middle of the bat this time
full and loopy on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
fullish and looped up in the channel around off, defended into the off side off the front foot
meets the pitch outside off with a long stride forward and whips to midwicket
full on the fifth-stump channel, blocked on the front foot
slightly flighted on middle, front-foot defense again
length ball, lets it turn and come onto him before patting it to forward short leg
pitched up outside off, eases it down to long-on with a gentle flick of the wrists
length ball, slides into his leg stump, shifts back and taps it right through the legs of short leg
short, wide, makes some room and carves out a punch to point
full and sliding into leg, drilled off the inside of the bat towards mid-on

pins him in front of middle and leg, and given. Dilruwan asks for a review. Looped up on middle, Perera comes forward to defend and he has got a massive inside edge onto the pad. But that only rules out the leg before because the ball has been caught at silly point. That's a horrific review. Dilruwan was asking the non-striker if it was caught before referring it to the third umpire. Wicket lost and review lost
slides across a fuller one on off, plants the front foot forward and bunts it into the off side
fullish, slid across even sharper this time and Dananjaya gets a good stride forward to drill it into the covers
full and sliding in on middle, blocked down the pitch
length ball on off, comes forward and defends
slightly fuller on middle, blocked down the pitch
leans forward and drives a fuller one through the covers
pitched up and slid into middle, driven to mid-off
length ball on off, defended solidly into the off side
full outside off, defended
fuller, driven into the off side
advances down the ground and drills into midwicket
comes forward to defend but the ball rips away and beats the outside edge
comes down the track and whips this fuller one into the leg side
short of a length, stays back and keeps it out though it doesn't get up much
length ball, gets forward and waits for it to turn before tucking it behind the short leg fielder
plants the front foot across and keeps the bat behind the pad and lets the ball hit him. Struck outside off
full toss, very wristily whipped away through midwicket and deep square leg runs to his left and dives in front of the boundary to stop it
length ball, spins away outside off, defended
clears the in-field now with an effortless loft over mid-off after meeting the pitch. Just times it
fullish length, comes forward and blocks off the outside of the bat
short of a length, waits before opening the face to point
comes down the track and smothers the spin as he drills it back to the bowler
fuller and pushed across outside off, pushed into the gap between cover and mid-off for one
pitched up on middle and off, driven to long-off
short, wide, rocks back and slashes a cut through backward of point
full outside off, pushed into the covers
length ball outside off, a slower one at 127ks, defended solidly into the off side
good length on off, defended from the crease
full, some late reverse swing outside off but it's just at 129ks and Roshen pushes it gently into the off side
slower ball at 121.8kmph, Roshen comes forward and plays really late by opening the face and getting it away off the outside of the bat between second slip and gully
fullish, pushed out to mid-off
short of good length, outside off, stands tall and punches into the covers
pitched up outside off, defended
short of a length, spins into him, lets it come on before making some room by backing away and punching through cover-point
comes down the track and drives to long-off
advances down the ground and chips a push down to long-on
pitched up on middle, blocked down the pitch

comes down the track and pushes to mid-off to set off for a really tight single. The fielder there flings the ball towards the keeper's end but it's wayward and beats the keeper diving to his right as they end up conceding overthrows
good length on off, stands tall and drops it in front of point
oh, shot! A very full delivery on the fourth or fifth-stump channel, Dananjaya carves out a drive right along the ground through the right of the cover fielder who chases it down
short of good length on off, gets on top and flicks to midwicket

ah, cuts in off the seam and misses everything - the inside edge, stumps and the keeper diving tohis right. Just grazes the left elbow as he pushes forward. That was the cutter and he was into the shot early
Appeal for leg before. Where was the impact? And was there an inside edge? Another cutter that cuts in off the seam and hits him in front of middle. Huge inside edge
short ball in the channel outside off, arches back and waits for it before patting it down into the off side
sliding fuller ball on leg, turned away into the on side off the front foot
flighted on off, driven down to long-off
fullish length, spinning in, defended
full and flighted on off, drilled down to long-on
full and tight on middle, blocked
advances down the ground and the bowler drags his length back but Roshen also adjusts well late by stabbing it to point
in the air and taken. The slower one has done him in here. Mushfiqur at cover dives forward to complete the catch as Dananaya comes forward and pushes early, as he chips it in the air
starts with a full toss which Herath dabs to cover and then flashes a big grin
in comes the yorker on leg stump and Herath whisks it away to long leg
pitches outside leg and hits Roshen's pads as he tries to flick. Don't even bother appealing
keeps out a very full delivery on off stump
cutter kicks up off the pitch and Roshen negotiates it well enough, yanking his bottom hand off and ensuring it goes to ground before reaching gully
taps a shortish delivery outside off through cover. Off strike immediately. That's poor from Bangladesh
fires it in on middle, Roshen turns it to short midwicket
beats him on the outside edge as Taijul slows it down, tosses it up, doesn't let Roshen get to the pitch and therefore gives himself the best chance of deceiving the batsman
steps out of his crease, turns a good length ball into an overpitched one, and drives back at the bowler
quicker and flatter on off stump, blocks
looks for the single after nudging the good length ball on middle to midwicket, but he's sent back and rightly so

spoons a catch to short cover! The ghost of the bouncer traps Herath on the crease, when he really should have been going forward. Simple catching practice for Mushfiqur as the batsman throws his hands at a full delivery outside off
looks for the yorker on leg stump, but Lakmal keeps it out
gets the cutter to dip sharply on the right-hander, who scoops it out to mid-off
shifts around the wicket now for a back of a length ball on off stump. Lakmal blocks.
shortish on off stump, Lakmal defends
flirts with a full delivery outside off and is thoroughly beaten.
88kph, goes back to block a good length ball on off stump
loops it up on middle, at 80 kph, Roshen defends it with great care
steps forward to a flighted delivery outside off and blocks
strides out of his crease to bunt a fairly full, and a pretty wide, delivery to long-off
drives to long-off and takes off for a jolly old single... until Roshen says dude, no.
tosses it up on middle, blocks
defends a good length ball from the crease, making sure to play close to his body
tosses it up on off stump, Roshen blunts it
presents the full face as he leans into a flighted delivery on middle
skips out to flick a full delivery on leg stump to deep midwicket. Skillful. And if Lakmal can keep out two balls, Roshen will have the strike again
good length ball on middle, keeps it out
pushes a full delivery on off stump to short cover
greets the slow, loopy delivery outside off with soft hands
races out of his crease and brings those wrists into play to find a couple of runs at long-on. He's on 49 now.
too wide outside off to draw a shot
a dance down the track, a roll of his wrists and Roshen has a fifty to savour. A simple, effective flick through midwicket, made so by his effort to use his feet and smother the turn
digs out a near yorker outside off
keeps to his crease and plants the straight bat down on a tossed up ball on middle
good length ball, pitching on off stump and turning off the straight. Roshen defends it right under his eyes
presses forward to smother the turn on this tossed up ball on middle
sets up for a defensive shot then waits for the ball to come to him
beats him by hitting a good length, at a slow pace, and all the revs he's putting in gets him the turn he wants off the pitch
short and outside off, Roshen scythes it through point all the way to the boundary
gets out of his crease, but Taijul cramps him with his line and the block to cover doesn't fetch the desired result
spears the full delivery outside off through cover
full on off stump, handles it easily

too short, too wide and Roshen stands tall to flay it to the right of the man at deep point. Splendid connection. Batsmen concentrating on defence as hard as he has been can sometimes miss out on such opportunities. Not him

realises the threat of Mustafizur when he comes around the wicket and aims at off stump - he gets the ball to straighten and secure the outside edge - so Roshen plays with soft hands and as late as possible. The result, a firm block off the middle
back over the wicket now and a full delivery outside off is sent to cover
looks to lash an overpitched delivery outside off through cover - a shot he possibly wouldn't have played if not for the No. 11 at the other end - and is beaten
a shade short, but not quite wide enough for the cut, which is why Lakmal mistimes the shot to cover
comes ever so slowly off the pitch and in that time Lakmal positions himself on off stump to whip the shortish delivery away to deep midwicket

appeal for caught behind and he's gone. A rippah to end the innings as Roshen. coming forward to defend what he thinks is a simple good length ball, suddenly spits up off the pitch, bounce so sharply that it takes a bit of the top glove through to the keeper
start off with a fuller length delivery outside off that Tamim strides forward to and drives into the off side
full, outside off, Tamim drills it down the ground. The bat face turns in his hands as he meets the pitch and he sends it along the ground through long-on

oh, gone! Tamim Iqbal's chipped a tame return catch and the crowd's gone silent. Tamim pays the price for being half-forward. That means he has to stretch out for his drive and he ends up chipping it from an awkward position. Lakmal gets down to his right on the follow through and snaffles it one-handed
short of good length, angled across the fourth or fifth-stump channel, shuffles across and shoulders arms
short of good length, angled across just outside off, Tamim is sure of his off-stump and lets it go
similar angle and length but slightly wider this time, no shot offered again
flighted outside off and just a little bit of turn outside off, pushed into the off side off the front foot
full and tight on off, puts his head down and bunts it out

looped up outside off, inviting the drive and he crunches it to mid-off. They set off for the single and the non-striker is pretty much jogging the single. Completely overlooks the throw from the fielder at the keeper's end. But, hang on, it only gets worse. Turns out he's covered decent ground and is nearly there. All he had to do was stretch forward and ground his bat. But he's limping forward with the bat in the air, holding it like a flag, making possible a run out that never should have happened. This is atrociously shoddy
pitched up outside off, drilled to mid-on
lots of flight outside off, plants the front foot forward and gets pinned on the pad. Impact well outside off
full on the stumps, crunched to mid-on
short of a length, angled across at 131 kmph, shuffles across and offers no shot
short of good length on middle, stands tall in the crease and check his whip, stays in the air momentarily but lands well short of the bowler
good length, angled across in the corridor of uncertainty, that could be very tempting. This is left alone but it's good bowling
keeps low. Short of a length, refuses to get up above shin height, he can't make any contact whatsoever as he plays at it from the crease
just back of a length in that channel outside off, Imrul shoulders arms
short of good length, cuts in to tuck him up and finds the inside edge as he punches off the backfoot
flighted outside off, draws him forward like a magnet and he drills it back to the bowler

was that dropped?. This is hilarious. Was there an edge? Could be, judging by their reaction. Looped up outside off and spinning in. Ah, seems like it has missed the bat and beaten the inside edge before lobbing in the air off the pad. Keeper and short leg excitedly run towards it. The former goes at it clumsily with reverse-cupped hands. He drops and short leg can't get his hands around the deflection
short, bit of width, cut to point
pushes this fuller one to mid-off
short of a length, dead accurate on off, defended off the backfoot
back of a length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and steers towards point
back of a length, cuts in sharply off the deck and hits the pad after getting past his attempted flick. Too high and going down leg
a brute of a short delivery outside off that he can't get anywhere on top of. Hangs his bat out loosely and almost has his outside edge shaved
good length outside off, shuffles across and blocks solidly into the covers
pushes well away from the body and almost walks into an ill-advised drive to one that holds its line outside his off-stump
sharp turn away from a back of a length, shifts back and pats it away into the offside
too short again and lots of width. That's really wasting a delivery. Imrul slashes a cut through backward of point
pitched up on middle, driven to mid-off
short of a length, a bit of turn outside off, punched off the backfoot through the covers
lobs off the pad to short leg who takes it above his head as it spins in sharply to him
another rap on the pad. Given this time. Mushfiqur reviews straight away. Looped up outside off, spins in and clips the inside edge before striking the pad. Mushfiqur survives
short of a length, keeps a little low, shuffles across to cover his off-stump and keeps it out on the off side
short of a length, shuffles across towards off and blocks down the pitch off the backfoot
short, wide, again keeps low and he misses out as he can't connect properly on the punch to cover
short of good length, angles into him and finds the outside edge as he sticks his bat out. Again, lack of bounce, so the edge drops short of slip
short, goes over leg-stump as he ducks under it
length ball, nips in and goes off the inside of the bat to midwicket as he presses forward to defend
looped up on off, blocked
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
no feet as he stays in the crease and defends and gets an outside edge that lands short of the only slip fielder
full and loopy outside off, comes forward very late and blocks. That kind of late movement is going to leave him rushed
full, driven to mid-off
edged and falls short. Pushes forward with hard hands to a fuller one that he may be better off leaving
length ball, holds its line on the fifth-stump channel, no shot offered
good length, nips in very late as Mushfiqur lets it go again
dangerous leave. Mushfiqur really can't brace for how much that has curved in towards his off-stump after pitching well outside off. Misses it by centimetres
short ball, ducked under easily and the bounce is too much
ah, misses again, as close as the last one. Shorter in length, again it cuts into him prodigiously and nearly, nearly shaves off-stump
a lot fuller inswinging delivery, negotiates it with a straight bat

clearly, he hasn't learned anything from the previous two instances. He has seen how far Lakmal is getting his deliveries to come into the batsman and still dares to shoulder arms. It was just short of a good length, but this time, the bounce is just enough to clatter into off-stump. At the very least, he needed to shuffle across to protect his stumps but he fails to do that too. Add the dropped catch, too, and you can't get any more lucky than that
really full outside off, bunted on the front foot
stays back to a fullish length ball and punches through the covers
length ball, turns square from outside off and he helps it along to fine leg
good length, spinning in, shuffles back and turns it away to backward short leg
lots of flight on middle and leg, dabbed into the leg side
flighted fuller length ball, stays back but not sure that's the safest position to be in, as he dabs it to short leg
oh, shot! Against the run of play, a glorious cover-drive from Imrul that pierces the cover field like a laser. At long last, something to offset the madness that has been this innings so far
short of a length, comes into him and finds the inside edge into the leg side
short of a length on middle, shuffles across and keeps it out
short of a length, angled into him and holds its line just outside off, sticks his bat out and gets beaten
pushes away from the body to a fullish one that just straightens a tad outside off and gets an edge between slips and gully. Right through the both of them
short of a length outside off, stabbed to point with an open face
beautiful little offbreak, the seam at 45 degrees, tossed up to draw the batsman forward, and Kayes rarely does come out of his crease, and then beats him off the pitch
rooted to the crease, when he really should be pressing forward, and as a result a lovely, flighted delivery on off stump skips past the outside edge
inches forward to block on off stump
a much better stride forward as he defends a full delivery on off stump
seems to want to push at the ball inside out through the covers, but then remembers this isn't the pitch to drive on the up
good length outside off, Kayes lets it spin past him
fullish on off stump, Liton taps it down
full and outside off, drives to the left of mid-off
covers the line of a back of a length delivery on off stump and meets it right under his eyes
full and swinging into the right-hander, targeting the stumps and the lbw, but Liton is more than up for the challenge
short and wide, Liton cuts trying to pick the gap to the right of point, but Gunathilaka does well there
nearly chops on as a short delivery comes to him a little quicker than he expects, gets up a little more than he expects too.
prods a full delivery on off stump to short cover
snags the outside edge as he keeps flighting the ball up and getting it to drift into the left-hander. This pitch will turn a line into a semi-circle, let alone a lovely offbreak like that
goes back and flicks a shortish delivery on off stump towards square leg
sneaks in a legbreak and Liton picks it
looks to block a good length offbreak on middle stump. And it almost rolls onto his stumps
shifts back deep in his crease, and because he allows himself that luxury, having picked the length of this shortish delivery, he's able to handle the big turn and extra bounce
starts with a short delivery which Kayes cuts to deep point
tosses it up, makes it drift into middle, Liton puts in a big stride and smothers the turn
quicker through the air, but still full on middle. The change in trajectory though makes Liton play from the crease
loops it up and gets the slightest turn off the pitch, enough to take a bit of an outside edge as Litoin blocks
drifts onto the pads and Liton loads up the sweep, hitting the ball powerfully to deep square leg
defends a full delivery outside off back to the bowler. However, he intended to close the face and perhaps pick up a single to midwicket

dropped but the ball comes at him with a great fury. Liton gives it everything he has as he charges down the pitch. Dilruwan feels the ball hit him before he even realises he has a catching opportunity
good length ball on middle, defends
turns from outside off all the way past his legs and into the keeper's gloves
works a good length ball from off stump past leg gully
down the track for a gentle clip to mid-on.
puts bat in front of pad and blocks a full delivery outside off.
goes for the cut, but the ball keeps coming on with the arm and cramps him
76 kph, lobs it up on middle, Liton treats it with gentle loving care
goes back to the full ball, because he can on a pitch that is turning, but often slowly. Then out comes a nudge behind square leg
smacks it against the spin through extra cover - the shot is made possibly by that front foot properly stretching forward
good length outside off, defends it
firm, forward press to blunt a full delivery outside off
goes back to block what becomes a straight ball outside off
massive turn from a good length area outside off. Liton goes back to flick but he is comfortably beaten
charges out of his crease and launches the ball - on middle and leg stump, so it's fit to be met with such disdain - over midwicket. Splendid footwork
shimmies down again, but Dilruwan bowls quicker and wide outside off and Liton has to block
lunges forward to block a good length ball outside off
hits against the turn but is able to do so because of that stride he's got going. Sweet cover drive
shortish and outside off, punches to cover
short of a length, shifts back and tucks away through midwicket for a brace

shout for leg before. Was there an inside edge? Hit him on the full. Sri Lanka have reviewed this. That's a half-volley, seemed like initially that it had hit him on the full. But this may have pitched outside leg. No inside edge found on the sweep. And, yes, pitching outside leg. Review lost
looped up outside off, big stride forward to block into the off side
slides in a fuller ball from around the wicket. Imrul plays around the front pad. Angling down leg, so leg before appeal turned down
tossed up on middle and leg, drilled down to long-on

another shout for leg before, not out is the call. Will they review again? Rod Tucker has a conversation with the SL players and there is no review taken. A big stride forward, so the impact could have been outside off
length on middle and leg, stays back and defends towards mid-on
pitched up outside off, blocked
full and curving in on off, defended
Sri Lanka go up in appeal for caught behind, umpire is unmoved. A length ball that he has been drawn forward to and rips past the outside edge

another shout for leg before, given but the batsman has reviewed straight away. Seems like there was an inside edge. Or has there? This could be bat hitting pad. Nothing on Ultra Edge. A loopy delivery that slides on with the arm. Imrul is playing for the turn and the ball pins him in front of middle and leg. Hitting leg stump as HawkEye confirms. Bangladesh have now lost a review
looped up on middle and off, caressed along the ground past the bowler
sliding length ball, going on straight with the arm and hitting him high. Going down leg
comes down the track and gets slightly opened up as he carves it away to point
loopy fuller ball on off, gets a good stride forward and eases it down to long-off
good length on off, gets forward and defends
slighted and sliding on leg, defended back
crisply drives to mid-off after getting a stride forward
that's a gift and has resulted in a boundary against the run of play. A flighted fuller ball that has been driven through the covers
back of a length, flat and turning in, walks across and pats it away to fine leg with a flat bat
full outside off, blocked off the front foot
full and looped up outside off, hammers a drive through the covers. That's two loose deliveries in the last over
and he safely keeps it out, lets this length ball spin in with the arm before tucking through backward of square leg
inside edge as this shapes into him. He's pushing away from the body on the front foot and chops it into the turf
good length and in at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
shot. He has clattered this past cover point. Length ball on the up that he is not to the pitch of. But the hands are confident as he slashes under this and bisects the field
outside edge lands well short of gully. Draws him forward and gets some lift outside off. Played with soft hands though
nearly finds cover as he looks to drive again. Once again, the stride is lacking. He ends up slicing it with hard hands. Cover point and cover are both close in but he gets this between them
length ball wide outside off, left alone
beats the outside edge first ball. And it's a superb ball. Dipping down on a good length, drawing him forward and getting big turn
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on this
beautiful. Lovely use of the feet from Miraz to meet it at the pitch outside off, and it's followed by a clean swing to send this sailing over the sightscreen
length at off stump, big stride as he drives to long-off
full at off stump, tapped back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot but he can't beat point's dive to the right
short of a length wide outside off, pushes at it away from the body and he's beaten again
length outside off, defended into the covers
length outside off, chases wide outside off and steers it to third man
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length on leg stump, dabbed to long leg off the back foot
length on off stump, pushed on the up to extra cover
length on off stump, dead-batted into the off side on the front foot
length outside off, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
good length outside off, defended with a big stride
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and coming into the corridor. Defended from the crease
beats the outside edge again. Moraz continues to push away from the body as Lakmal draws him wide
short ball on middle stump, gets on top of it and drops it softly into the leg side to steal the single
good length and in at leg stump, nudged through midwicket on the up
good length outside off, defended off the inside half and it's another easy single through the vacant midwicket region

bowled him! Lakmal gets another one! Three wickets for the pacer and it's his persistent line again that's done it. Another length ball at about a seventh stump line. Liton, who has been happy leaving and defending so far, goes after this and finds it hasn't risen as he expected. No feet, only hands. Angled bat induces an inside edge that finds it's way to off stump on the bounce
back of a length and coming in. Opens the face and chops this wide of backward point
good length on off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
good length and angled in at off stump. Watchfully pushed into the leg side
another arm ball, but this pitches leg stump and slides further down
drives uppishly and wide of short extra cover. Herath bowls this from wide of the crease, getting massive drift in. Miraz not to the pitch as he pushes on the front foot
full on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
short ball outside off, tapped straight to point with no feet
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot to point

outside edge against a full ball. This is in the corridor and he's looking to defend with a late stride. It nips away off the surface and he ends up inside the line. The edge doesn't carry to second slip
good length outside off, defended off the outside half of the bat. Once again, he's inside the line because of that unconfident front foot stride
back of a length just outside off, gets leg side, exposes two stumps and pushes away from the body into the covers
inswinger that catches the inside edge this time. Has the batsman stuck, with the front foot planted across the body as this ball rises at him from a length at an off stump line
full outside off, plants the front leg ahead and drives to long-off

beaten on the inside edge. It's that gap between bat and pad again. Front foot moves maybe a centimetre ahead and then stops. Only the upper body continues moving forward. Enough time for Herath to sneak an arm ball through. It misses off stump
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, squares him up with the spin. He goes on the back foot and watches closely to follow it with soft hands to defend
length and spinning away from middle stump, dead-batted on the back foot
short ball wide outside off, ducks under it
good length on leg stump, clipped to fine leg from the crease
good length and in at off stump, defended on the back foot
inside edge onto pad. Looks to drive on the up outside off, front leg not near the ball
good length just outside off, defended into the covers

trapped in front of middle as he looks to flick. He's deep in the crease and this strikes him high on the pad with leg stump visible. Sri Lanka have reviewed it. His ankles are close together and he's standing on his toes as he misses this. It's hit him on the thigh guard and tracker confirms it's missing leg stump. Sri Lanka lose their review
full at off stump, steps out and yorks himself
tossed up at off stump, steps out and drives to long-off
good length outside off, zips away from him as he goes on the back foot. Beaten on the outside edge
short of a length outside off, backs away and cuts to backward point
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, gets under it and top-edges the sweep to long leg's right
inside edge onto pad, but he's planted the front foot far outside off and he's safe on the lbw appeal
doesn't get to the pitch this time and gets an inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick from outside off
tossed up outside off, driven to long-on
length at middle stump, decisive skip forward to reach the pitch as he pushes to long-on
legbreak on middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the up
good length wide outside off, steps out and smothers it after it turns into him
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended into the covers on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length and staying low outside off. Sliced to point off the back foot
good length and dipping on middle stump. Defended on the front foot off the outside half of the bat
full on middle stump, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up outside off, takes it on the full and sweeps to long leg
legbreak, good length on middle stump. Comes on slowly and he is able to pick it off the pitch to defend
another legbreak, full on off stump, defended into the covers
good length on off stump, defended with the turn into the off side
good length and in at off stump. Keeps low as he goes on the back foot. Defended off the toe end
full on off stump, driven to extra cover on the front foot
good length on middle stump, nudged into the leg side off the back foot
big turn but it's also dying on him. Outside edge slips past first slip's attempt to the left. He was chasing with his arms again, on the back foot
beats the outside edge after pushing him on the back foot. This time he pushes it through flatter and gets it to bounce and turn sharply unlike the previous ball
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length and turning in at off stump as he goes on the back foot. Manages to open the face and guide this past slip
full on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
tossed up on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length topspinner with the legbreak release. He makes room and pushes this wide of mid-off off the back foot
offbreak floated up at leg stump. Flicked to deep midwicket on the front foot
tossed up full on off stump, big stride forward and defended
full on off stump, firmly struck down the ground but stopped by the bowler
full on middle and off, prods forward and blocks
full on off stump once more, backs away and drives down the ground, but can't beat the man at mid off

uses his feet, and lifted over cover. Work for the man at cover as he gives it a chase, but can't parry it back. Saw Mahmudullah coming down the ground and dropped it slightly shorter outside off. Almost deceived the batsman but Mahmudullah did enough to clear the infield
back of a length outside off, tries to poke at it but misses. Sharply collected by Dickwella
drifted full on off stump, turns away from the right hander, but struck firmly back
full on off stump, steps forward and defends towards the non striker
on a good length on middle and leg, turning into the right-hander's body, forced to hurry onto the back foot and worked towards square leg
full on middle and leg, bunted to the man at long on. Minimal footwork on this occasion
tossed up outside off, carved off the front foot through covers, work for Lakmal in the deep
full on off stump, turning into the batsman. Struck firmly back to Akila
back of a length outside off, turns into the batsman. Tentatively defended
full on off stump, too close to his body for the perfect reverse sweep, but paddled well enough as it flies past first slip. Risky shot, and hit well. Just goes past the man at slip
full on off stump, sharp offspin. Comes down the wicket and turns it towards midwicket
good length on off stump, and it stays low on this occasion. Does well to negate the spin and play it in front of his body
full ball just outside off, big stride forward but defended down the wrong line. It's the straighter one, and it zips straight past the outside edge
full on off stump, driven back past the non-striker to long on
full on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover
full on off stump, big stride forward and paddled fine down the leg side. Helps the ball along its way and first slip goes chasing behind it. Eventually stopped by fine leg
tossed up full outside off stump, very well defended off the front foot. Offers the bat's full face
full on middle and off, spinning across the right-hander's body but well defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, spins sharply into the batsman as he backs away towards the leg side. Cut late and beats the man at point. Quick call for the second run and easily completed
tossed up full outside off, spins into him and defended
full just outside off, offspin. Defended off the front foot to Dilruwan
tossed up full outside off, once again gets to the pitch of the ball and hits it back
back of a length outside off, no spin this time as it goes straight through. Forces the batsman to go onto the back foot and tapped back
full on off stump, charges down the wicket but cramped for space. Turned to midwicket
full just outsid off, tries to work this towards the leg side but induces the leading edge on this occasion! Falls short of cover though
back of a length on middle and leg, stays on the back foot as he tries to flick this down the leg side. Comes off his hips as the ball trickles away to fine leg
full just outside off, slight offspin into the captain. Defended back to the bowler

through the gates and there's his maiden wicket! Tossed up nicely outside off, ball pitches outside off stump and grips & turns into Mahmudullah. He tries to drive but there's a big enough gap between bat and pad. Crashes into off stump
full ball just outside off, turns into the new batsman as he tries the front-foot defense. Bat-pad as the bowler appeals for lbw
full outside off, prods forward and blocks

another wicket! Soft dismissal. Full outside off, and spins into Sabbir. Tries to drive straight but it comes off the bat's inside half. Low catch from the captain at midwicket, and there's two in one over!
full and quick on off stump, defended towards the leg side
back of a length outside off, hops onto the back foot and taps back to Dilruwan
good length on middle and leg, spinning further down the leg side. Sharp take from Dickwella
back of a length on middle stump, turning into him, flicked towards the leg side
full just outside off, defends with the bat's open face, runs it down to short third man
full on middle stump, smacked towards the leg side with minimal foot movement. Dribbles away towards midwicket and gets Miraz back on strike
good length just outside off, big turn into Miraz and almost beats him! Does well to get his bat down in time, and takes an inside edge towards the leg side
tossed up full outside off, defended off the front foot to Akila
there's his third! Full on off stump, and he check drives off the front foot. Lobs up straight back to the bowler. Simplest of catches
full outside off, and Taijul ain't wasting any time. Slogged towards the leg side, but only to midwicket
full outside off, grips and turns away from the left hander, defended with soft hands
dropped by the bowler! Full outside off, and he tries to slog towards the leg side. Sliced, and skied over the bowler's head. Dives too, but can't hold on
full on middle and leg, the turn takes it down the leg side
back of a length outside off, spinning away from the left hander, cut but only to backward point
back of a length on off stump, spins away from Taijul as he tries to cut once again. Straight to point

beautiful work from short leg! Mendis the man there. Full ball on middle stump, that's tapped to short leg, but the batsman is out of his crease and Mendis is quick to throw the stumps down. Taijul is stranded and that wicket is all Kusal Mendis

is that two in two? Full on middle stump and zipping straight through. Trapped in front of middle and leg and Dilruwan appeals for the lbw. Given by the umpire, but Bangladesh are reviewing. Impact was on middle and leg, and would've crashed onto leg stump. He's got to go, and Bangladesh concede a 112-run lead
full on middle and leg, comfortably tapped off his pads to deep backward square

tossed up outside off, no spin this time as he under edges the cut, beats the keeper and Sabbir gives it a chase from first slip. Does very well to parry it back. That shot could've easily been chopped onto his stumps too
tossed up on middle and leg, comes down the wicket and tries to lift this towards the on side, but takes an inside edge onto his pads and down the leg side
full on off stump, spinning into Mendis and tapped back to the bowler
big appeal but turned down! Full on middle stump and straightening after pitching. Misses the sweep and Razzak gives out a full throated shout. Came off his arm
back of a length outside off, and spinning further away. Left alone to see the first over off
full outside off and swinging slightly in. Shoulders his arms as it carries through to Liton
good length outside off, goes chasing behind it and pokes at it tentatively, takes the outside edge but falls short of second slip! Allows them to scamper across
full outside off but angling into the left hander, firmly driven to mid off
full on middle stump, and that's easily whipped off his toes. Beats square leg and it's a big chase for fine leg, but intercepted inside the boundary
full on off stump, walks down the ground and taps it to mid on. Off the middle of the bat
full on off stump, driven to cover and that's lunch!
back of a length and in at off stump, backs away and cuts to point
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot off the outside half
big appeal for catch as Dimuth reaches out at leg stump and gets pad on this ball. There was no edge and leg gully's appeal is turned down
good length and down leg side, left alone
length on middle stump, flicked through midwicket
full on middle stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length and down leg side, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
good length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket off the back foot
inside edge as he looks to defend this arm ball. Onto pad and safely away from short leg
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length wide outside leg stump, spins and bounces past Liton of whom to much was being asked
back of a length and in at leg stump, punched to midwicket off the back foot
good length on off stump, inside half of the bat on the forward defence
drops it short and Mendis hurries onto the back foot to drag this over midwicket with a pull. Doesn't middle it and deep square leg can clean up
back of a length at off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
beaten on the outside edge. Lovely looping ball outside off from Razzak who draws him in with the drift and trajectory, only to spin it past quickly
length outside off, pushed through point off the front foot
another inside edge for Mendis, leaving a gap as he defends on the front foot. Another arm ball from Taijul. Strikes him on the front pad
short of a length outside off, spinning away quickly as he pushes on the back foot. Follows with his hands and pokes it into the covers
full ball on middle stump, sweeps along the floor through square leg. Mushfiqur runs to his right from deep midwicket and stops with his right leg
short of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
whacks the sweep straight into short leg. Would've been four. This was picked up well from middle stump
tossed up outside off, stays inside the line as he drives to mid-off
good length outside off, pushes on the front foot and gets it off the outside half of the bat
good length on leg stump, defended to short leg off the inside half
full at off stump. Shapes to sweep and realises quickly it's coming in at him. Re-adjusts and digs out what has now become a yorker

Mendis has reviewed what will be a plumb lbw decision if he hasn't got bat on it...and it looks like he hasn't as he's struck ankle-height right in front of off stump. That's a terrible review. This is hitting leg stump. Misses the arm ball completely
beaten as he looks to freeze against this. Bat, feet, everything static as this fall is in the air. It's short of a length outside off and he ends up stabbing hurriedly as it spins away
full on middle stump, flicked t midwicket
good length on middle stump, flicked to long leg from the crease
short ball at off stump, sliding in with the arm. Backs away and cuts to point
length at leg stump, pokes it back down the pitch with a bat-pad
short of a length outside off, makes room and taps it to extra cover
good length and in at off stump, defended into the off side off the front foot
floated up at middle stump, drives straight to short midwicket who fumbles but manages to keep them from taking a run
arm ball slides straight on as he looks to defend in front of off stump. It keeps low too. Dug out off the toe end
back of a length and coming in at middle stump, flicked to long leg off the back foot
driven aerially towards long-off. Tossed up outside off and he doesn't make it to the pitch of the ball as he looks to drive
good length and pushed through flat outside off. Dead-batted into the off side
back of a length and in at leg stump, dabbed to leg gully on the bounce
full on middle stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length and turning away outside off. Plenty of time to rock onto the back foot and slap this in front of cover point
full at middle stump, exposes the stumps, opens the wrists and squeezes this drive through point. Nicely executed
nearly loses off stump. Doesn't pick this arm ball and leaves it. Narrowly saved on the front foot
glorious shot. Length ball coming in at off stump, reaches out and goes inside-out over extra cover
done by the arm ball again. Length ball outside off and he's looking to drive. Inside edge onto pad
good length on middle stump, defended to short leg off the inside half
tossed up on leg stump, shapes to drive but ends up kicking it away
good length and tossed up outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
full outside off, drives towards long-on and the straightish midwicket fielder puts in a dive to his right. He can't collect cleanly, however. Parries it into the off side
expertly placed past slip. Short of a length and turning away a touch. He backs away and caresses it with the face of the bat. Backward point cleans up
arm ball fired in at leg stump, he goes forward and allows it to hit his pad
good length and in at off stump. Defended to extra cover off the back foot

full and in at off stump. Pushed through fast and he bat-pads into the covers...looks innocuous but Bangladesh have reviewed the not out decision for lbw. That decision will stand. He was struck outside off. It was a bump-ball too, and silly point hadn't taken it. Looks like another one of the series of poor reviews today
length on off stump, defended off the inside half of the bat
back of a length at off stump, chopped to backward point
good length on off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length and in at off stump. Tapped to point off the back foot
keeps on going. Tossed up at middle stump. He knows to be forward. Then, he improvises to reach this low and picks it with the angle to sweep through square leg
caught between a sweep and a drive this time. An awkward attempt to shovel this full ball through midwicket. Struck on the back leg outside leg stump
good length on leg stump, under-edge on the sweep. Gets it out to deep midwicket
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
dropped short outside off. Skids through fast and he's late on the pull. Rolls feebly to midwicket
good length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket on the front foot
tossed up at off stump, steps out and jams it out to long-off
full on off stump, driven on the bounce to short extra cover
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended to silly point
back of a length and in at off stump. Squeezed out to point off the back foot
good length on off stump, steps out and gets the pad in the way after being beaten in flight
chops it from the stumps and manages to get four. Oh he isn't afraid to play his shots. This is an arm ball headed for off stump and he gets bat on it very very late
tossed up on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up at off stump, dug out to long-off
good length on leg stump, inside edge as he looks to defend on the front foot
nicely played. Will get only one. Full at off stump, paddles it to fine leg
another dangerous shot. Steps out pre-emptively and is forced to hop back as this is short and spinning away. Still manages to reach out and dab it wide of slip
length on off stump, steps out and pads it into the off side
good length on off stump, defended off the inside half of the bat
tossed up on off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length on off stump, defended down the pitch
length outside off. Opens the face to try and cut but ends up getting glove on it
arm ball takes the inside edge as he looks to defend on the front foot
full outside off, steps out and flicks to short midwicket
full outside off, gets down and takes it on the full as he paddles to fine leg
back of a length on off stump, chops it late to backward point

one too many from De Silva. Kept opening the face to balls on the stumps and it was inevitable that he would miss one. This is a length ball at middle stump, turning away. He exposes off and middle and loses the former as the ball spins past the open face. Taijul does well to push one up.
good length outside off, turns into the left hander, defended with soft hands off the back foot
good length just outside off, but turn and bounce off the surface! Surprises the batsman as he can't get bat to ball. Hits him near the gut
full on middle stump, accurate stuff on a yorker length. Defended back to Mehidy
good length outside off, angling into the batsman and punched off the back foot. Straight to point
good length on middle, defended
back of a length on middle and leg, turning across the left hander, played with the bat's open face towards the off side
back of a length on off stump, backs away and cuts to point. Calls early for the single, and they scamper across
tossed up on off stump, big stride forward and defended back
full on off stump, comes down the ground to mid on
full outside off, down on one knee and swept furiously to deep backward square
swept again, and this time it finds the gap on the leg side. Tossed up outside off and whips his sweep. Played in the air, but between deep midwicket and deep backward square
back of a length on off stump, extra bounce once again off the surface. Misses the defense
good length on off stump, and turns sharply into the batsman. He had walked across to the off side and the ball takes his pads and runs down the leg side
full on middle stump, paddled down fine to the leg side. Quick to gauge the length of the ball
full on off stump, straightens after pitching, defended with soft hands off the front foot
full on off stump once again, big stride forward and blocked
good length wide outside off, angling into Karunaratne. Fended towards the off side. Played from the back foot
back of a length outside off, backs away towards the leg side and carves it to deep point. Well negated by the batsman
Firmly struck down the ground to Fizz at long off. Full on off stump and he meets the ball by coming down the ground. Driven along the carpet
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to short cover. No chance of a single
back of a length on middle stump, works it towards the leg side. Played with the spin off the back foot
good length on off stump, no spin this time. Gets behind the line of the ball and tucks it to square leg with soft hands

huge appeal for lbw! But turned down. Good length on off stump and the batsman comes down the wicket trying to work it towards the leg side, but... it's a straight one and the batsman played for the spin. Close call
full just outside, and zipping straight through to the keeper. Gunathilaka covers his off-stump line and lets it go through
short on middle stump, turning towards the leg side and he misses the sweep-pull. Comes off the glove and the keeper can't hold on to it. Tough, but goes down as dropped!

another big appeal for caught behind! But once again turned down. Good length just outside off, another one that goes straight on and this time it's just past the bat's outside edge. Sharp take from Liton, and they're interested for the catch. But Razzak and co. decide not to review
good length on off stump, comes down the wicket and smacks this back to the bowler. He's out of his crease and the bowler has a shy at the stumps.
full on off stump, uses his feet once again and driven. But straight to cover
tosses it up on this occasion. Pitches just outside off, and defended off the front foot
beautiful! Full on off stump, and spins away from the left hander after gripping the surface. Flies across the bat's outside edge
full on off stump, big stride forward and defended back towards the non-striker. Safe shot
back of a length on off stump, stays on the back foot and punches to mid off
width offered outside off but can't put it away. Short ball and it was in the slot to be hit, but mistimed to mid off
full on off stump, tapped down the ground past the non-striker to long on. Razzak's dive wasn't good enough to stop that from going through
flighted on middle and leg, and enough time for Gunathilaka to walk across to the off side and paddle this fine. Goes to fine leg, who's placed slightly square
full on middle and leg, tentatively tapped towards the leg side
good length outside off, spinning into the batsman. Enough time to cut this square to deep point
flighted on off stump, comes down the wicket and tries to hit it straight past the non-striker. But the leading edge takes it towards cover instead
good length on off stump, Gunathilaka comes charging down the wicket but checks his shot. Tapped back to the bowler
good length outside off, stands tall and punches towards cover off the back foot. Comes off Kayes' shin at silly point. He's in pain. Time for the physio. Kayes leaves the field for more treatment
full on off stump, firmly struck past wide mid off to Fizz in the deep. Shouts of 'catch it' but away from any infielder
full on off stump, opens the bat's face and runs it down to short third man. He wants the single, but quick work from the fielder ensures it's a dot
